[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Gas bypass on cached values] When loaded=None (cached hit), is gas charging properly skipped, or can attackers exploit repeated borrows to extract state for free? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Type confusion attack] Can borrowing with mismatched type arguments return values with incorrect layouts, causing memory corruption when dereferenced? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Memory accounting error] Does mem_usage calculation accurately reflect GlobalValue memory overhead, or can deeply nested references undercount actual usage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Delayed field deserialization] Can delayed fields fail to deserialize properly when contains_delayed_fields flag is incorrect, causing runtime panics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Resolver data corruption] If TableResolver returns corrupted bytes for valid keys, does deserialize_value properly detect corruption or propagate invalid state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Concurrent modification] Can concurrent borrow_box and remove_box operations cause use-after-free on the returned reference? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Gas feature version inconsistency] Can gas_feature_version changes mid-transaction cause different validators to charge different amounts, breaking consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_contains_box()] [TOCTOU vulnerability] Can contains_box return true but concurrent remove_box delete the entry before subsequent access, bypassing NOT_FOUND checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_contains_box()] [Gas exploitation] Does contains_box charge proper gas for cache population, or can attackers use it to cheaply populate GlobalValue cache for later free access? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_contains_box()] [Deleted entry confusion] Can GlobalValue::exists() incorrectly return true for entries marked for deletion, causing logic errors in Move contracts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_contains_box()] [Resolver inconsistency] If resolver.resolve_table_entry_bytes_with_layout returns Some() then None for the same key in different calls, can this cause non-deterministic exists results? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_contains_box()] [Memory side-effect] Does contains_box properly clean up loaded GlobalValue when exists=false, or can repeated contains calls exhaust memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_remove_box()] [Double-free vulnerability] Can calling remove_box twice for the same key cause use-after-free when GlobalValue::move_from destroys the value? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_remove_box()] [Resource leak] If move_from succeeds but gas charging fails at lines 607-611, does the removed value get properly dropped or leak memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_remove_box()] [Deletion bypass] Can removing an entry while references to it exist via borrow_box cause dangling references and memory corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_remove_box()] [Gas manipulation] Does dropping table_data before charging allow attackers to delete entries but abort before paying gas costs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_remove_box()] [Type confusion on return] Can type mismatches between stored value and expected return type cause memory corruption when returning the deleted value? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_remove_box()] [Partial removal] If value deserialization fails after deletion, is the entry permanently deleted but value irrecoverable, causing fund loss? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_remove_box()] [Change set inconsistency] Does move_from properly mark the entry as Op::Delete in GlobalValue effects, or can removed entries persist in change sets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_remove_box()] [Memory accounting error] Is heap memory freed when removing entries, or does use_heap_memory at line 609 incorrectly charge for already-removed values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_destroy_empty_box()] [Non-empty table destruction] Does destroy_empty_box verify the table is actually empty before marking for deletion, or can non-empty tables be destroyed causing data loss? (Critical)
